verses.verse: He that is wounded <S%H1795><s%> in the stones, or has his privy <S%H8212><s%> member cut <S%H3772><s%> off, shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

A bastard <S%H4464><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> to his tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall he not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

An Ammonite <S%H5984><s%> or Moabite <S%H4125><s%> shall not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> to their tenth <S%H6224><s%> generation <S%H1755><s%> shall they not enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%>

Because <S%H5921><s%> they met <S%H6923><s%> you not with bread <S%H3899><s%> and with water <S%H4325><s%> in the way, <S%H1870><s%> when you came <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> and because <S%H834><s%> they hired <S%H7936><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you Balaam <S%H1109><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Beor <S%H1160><s%> of Pethor <S%H6604><s%> of Mesopotamia, <S%H763><s%> to curse <S%H7043><s%> you.

Nevertheless the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not listen <S%H8085><s%> to Balaam; <S%H1109><s%> but the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> turned <S%H2015><s%> the curse <S%H7045><s%> into a blessing <S%H1293><s%> to you, because <S%H3588><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> loved <S%H157><s%> you.
You shall not seek <S%H1875><s%> their peace <S%H7965><s%> nor their prosperity <S%H2896><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> your days <S%H3117><s%> for ever. <S%H5769><s%>

You shall not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Edomite; <S%H130><s%> for he is your brother: <S%H251><s%> you shall not abhor <S%H8581><s%> an Egyptian; <S%H4713><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> you were <S%H1961><s%> a stranger <S%H1616><s%> in his land. <S%H776><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> that are begotten <S%H3205><s%> of them shall enter <S%H935><s%> into the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> in their third <S%H7992><s%> generation. <S%H1755><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> the host <S%H4264><s%> goes <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> your enemies, <S%H341><s%> then keep <S%H8104><s%> you from every <S%H3605><s%> wicked <S%H7451><s%> thing. <S%H1697><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> there be among you any man, <S%H376><s%> that is not clean <S%H2889><s%> by reason of uncleanness <S%H7137><s%> that chances <S%H4745><s%> him by night, <S%H3915><s%> then shall he go <S%H3318><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> out of the camp, <S%H4264><s%> he shall not come <S%H935><s%> within <S%H8432><s%> the camp: <S%H4264><s%>

But it shall be, when evening <S%H6153><s%> comes <S%H6437><s%> on, he shall wash <S%H7364><s%> himself with water: <S%H4325><s%> and when the sun <S%H8121><s%> is down, <S%H935><s%> he shall come <S%H935><s%> into <S%H8432><s%> the camp <S%H4264><s%> again.
You shall have <S%H1961><s%> a place <S%H4725><s%> also without <S%H2351><s%> the camp, <S%H4264><s%> where <S%H8033><s%> you shall go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> abroad: <S%H2351><s%>

And you shall have <S%H1961><s%> a paddle <S%H3489><s%> on your weapon; <S%H240><s%> and it shall be, when you will ease <S%H3427><s%> yourself abroad, <S%H2351><s%> you shall dig <S%H2658><s%> therewith, and shall turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> and cover <S%H3680><s%> that which comes <S%H6627><s%> from you:

For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of your camp, <S%H4264><s%> to deliver <S%H5337><s%> you, and to give <S%H5414><s%> up your enemies <S%H341><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you; therefore shall your camp <S%H4264><s%> be holy: <S%H6918><s%> that he see <S%H7200><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> unclean <S%H6172><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> in you, and turn <S%H7725><s%> away from you.
You shall not deliver <S%H5462><s%> to his master <S%H113><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is escaped <S%H5337><s%> from his master <S%H113><s%> to you:

He shall dwell <S%H3427><s%> with you, even among <S%H7130><s%> you, in that place <S%H4725><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he shall choose <S%H977><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> of your gates, <S%H8179><s%> where it likes <S%H2896><s%> him best: <S%H2896><s%> you shall not oppress <S%H3238><s%> him.

There shall be no <S%H3808><s%> whore <S%H6948><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> a sodomite <S%H6945><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

You shall not bring <S%H935><s%> the hire <S%H868><s%> of a whore, <S%H2181><s%> or the price <S%H4242><s%> of a dog, <S%H3611><s%> into the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> for any <S%H3605><s%> vow: <S%H5088><s%> for even <S%H1571><s%> both these are abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>

You shall not lend <S%H5391><s%> on usury <S%H5391><s%> to your brother; <S%H251><s%> usury <S%H5392><s%> of money, <S%H3701><s%> usury <S%H5392><s%> of victuals, <S%H400><s%> usury <S%H5392><s%> of any <S%H3605><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> that is lent <S%H5391><s%> on usury: <S%H5391><s%>

To a stranger <S%H5237><s%> you may lend <S%H5391><s%> on usury; <S%H5391><s%> but to your brother <S%H251><s%> you shall not lend <S%H5391><s%> on usury: <S%H5391><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> you in all <S%H3605><s%> that you set <S%H4916><s%> your hand <S%H3027><s%> to in the land <S%H776><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> you go <S%H935><s%> to possess <S%H3423><s%> it.

When <S%H3588><s%> you shall vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> you shall not slack <S%H309><s%> to pay <S%H7999><s%> it: for the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> will surely require <S%H1875><s%> it of you; and it would be sin <S%H2399><s%> in you.
But if <S%H3588><s%> you shall forbear <S%H2308><s%> to vow, <S%H5088><s%> it shall be no <S%H3808><s%> sin <S%H2399><s%> in you.

That which <S%H834><s%> is gone <S%H4161><s%> out of your lips <S%H8193><s%> you shall keep <S%H8104><s%> and perform; <S%H6213><s%> even a freewill <S%H5071><s%> offering, according as you have vowed <S%H5087><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God, <S%H430><s%> which you have promised <S%H1696><s%> with your mouth. <S%H6310><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> you come <S%H935><s%> into your neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> then you may eat <S%H398><s%> grapes <S%H6025><s%> your fill <S%H7648><s%> at your own pleasure; <S%H5315><s%> but you shall not put <S%H5414><s%> any in your vessel. <S%H3627><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> you come <S%H935><s%> into the standing <S%H7054><s%> corn <S%H7054><s%> of your neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> then you may pluck <S%H6998><s%> the ears <S%H4425><s%> with your hand; <S%H3027><s%> but you shall not move <S%H5130><s%> a sickle <S%H2770><s%> to your neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> standing <S%H7054><s%> corn. <S%H7054><s%>
